text: An account of the genealogy of Jesus the Messiah, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham was the father of Isaac, and Isaac the father of Jacob, and Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judah the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar, and Perez the father of Hezron, and Hezron the father of Aram,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Aram the father of Aminadab, and Aminadab the father of Nahshon, and Nahshon the father of Salmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Salmon the father of Boaz by Rahab, and Boaz the father of Obed by Ruth, and Obed the father of Jesse,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and Jesse the father of King David.
And David was the father of Solomon by the wife of Uriah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Solomon the father of Rehoboam, and Rehoboam the father of Abijah, and Abijah the father of Asaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Asaph the father of Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat the father of Joram, and Joram the father of Uzziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Uzziah the father of Jotham, and Jotham the father of Ahaz, and Ahaz the father of Hezekiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hezekiah the father of Manasseh, and Manasseh the father of Amos, and Amos the father of Josiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Josiah the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the deportation to Babylon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the deportation to Babylon: Jechoniah was the father of Salathiel, and Salathiel the father of Zerubbabel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zerubbabel the father of Abiud, and Abiud the father of Eliakim, and Eliakim the father of Azor,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azor the father of Zadok, and Zadok the father of Achim, and Achim the father of Eliud,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eliud the father of Eleazar, and Eleazar the father of Matthan, and Matthan the father of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jacob the father of Joseph the husband of Mary, who bore Jesus, who is called the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David to the deportation to Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the deportation to Babylon to the Messiah, fourteen generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the birth of Jesus the Messiah took place in this way. When his mother Mary had been engaged to Joseph, but before they lived together, she was found to be pregnant from the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her husband Joseph, being a righteous man and unwilling to expose her to public disgrace, planned to divorce her quietly.
speaker: Narrator

text: But just when he had resolved to do this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for the child conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: She will bear a son, and you are to name him Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.”
speaker: Narrator

text: All this took place to fulfill what had been spoken by the Lord through the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Look, the virgin shall become pregnant and give birth to a son,
    and they shall name him Emmanuel,”
which means, “God is with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joseph awoke from sleep, he did as the angel of the Lord commanded him; he took her as his wife
speaker: Narrator

text: but had no marital relations with her until she had given birth to a son, and he named him Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the time of King Herod, after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea, magi from the east came to Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: asking, “Where is the child who has been born king of the Jews? For we observed his star in the east and have come to pay him homage.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When King Herod heard this, he was frightened, and all Jerusalem with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and calling together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired of them where the Messiah was to be born.
speaker: Narrator

text: They told him, “In Bethlehem of Judea, for so it has been written by the prophet:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘And you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah,
    are by no means least among the rulers of Judah,
for from you shall come a ruler
    who is to shepherd my people Israel.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod secretly called for the magi and learned from them the exact time when the star had appeared.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he sent them to Bethlehem, saying, “Go and search diligently for the child, and when you have found him, bring me word so that I may also go and pay him homage.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had heard the king, they set out, and there, ahead of them, went the star that they had seen in the east, until it stopped over the place where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw that the star had stopped, they were overwhelmed with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: On entering the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they knelt down and paid him homage. Then, opening their treasure chests, they offered him gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having been warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they left for their own country by another road.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after they had left, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, “Get up, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt, and remain there until I tell you, for Herod is about to search for the child, to destroy him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph got up, took the child and his mother by night, and went to Egypt
speaker: Narrator

text: and remained there until the death of Herod. This was to fulfill what had been spoken by the Lord through the prophet, “Out of Egypt I have called my son.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Herod saw that he had been tricked by the magi, he was infuriated, and he sent and killed all the children in and around Bethlehem who were two years old or under, according to the time that he had learned from the magi.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what had been spoken through the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“A voice was heard in Ramah,
    wailing and loud lamentation,
Rachel weeping for her children;
    she refused to be consoled, because they are no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Herod died, an angel of the Lord suddenly appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Get up, take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who were seeking the child’s life are dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joseph got up, took the child and his mother, and went to the land of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he heard that Archelaus was ruling Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. And after being warned in a dream, he went away to the district of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he made his home in a town called Nazareth, so that what had been spoken through the prophets might be fulfilled, “He will be called a Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness of Judea, proclaiming,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the one of whom the prophet Isaiah spoke when he said,
“The voice of one crying out in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way of the Lord;
    make his paths straight.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now John wore clothing of camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist, and his food was locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jerusalem and all Judea and all the region around the Jordan were going out to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they were baptized by him in the River Jordan, confessing their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, bear fruit worthy of repentance,
speaker: Narrator

text: and do not presume to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our ancestor,’ for I tell you, God is able from these stones to raise up children to Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even now the ax is lying at the root of the trees; therefore every tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I baptize you with water for repentance, but the one who is coming after me is more powerful than I, and I am not worthy to carry his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will clear his threshing floor and will gather his wheat into the granary, but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to John at the Jordan, to be baptized by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: John would have prevented him, saying, “I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered him, “Let it be so now, for it is proper for us in this way to fulfill all righteousness.” Then he consented.
speaker: Jesus

text: And when Jesus had been baptized, just as he came up from the water, suddenly the heavens were opened to him and he saw God’s Spirit descending like a dove and alighting on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a voice from the heavens said, “This is my Son, the Beloved, with whom I am well pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tested by the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: He fasted forty days and forty nights, and afterward he was famished.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tempter came and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command these stones to become loaves of bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he answered, “It is written,
‘One does not live by bread alone,
    but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil took him to the holy city and placed him on the pinnacle of the temple,
speaker: Narrator

text:
saying to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written,
‘He will command his angels concerning you,’
    and ‘On their hands they will bear you up,
so that you will not dash your foot against a stone.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Again it is written, ‘Do not put the Lord your God to the test.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said to him, “All these I will give you, if you will fall down and worship me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Jesus said to him, “Away with you, Satan! for it is written,
‘Worship the Lord your God,
    and serve only him.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil left him, and suddenly angels came and waited on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew to Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: He left Nazareth and made his home in Capernaum by the sea, in the territory of Zebulun and Naphtali,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that what had been spoken through the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Land of Zebulun, land of Naphtali,
    on the road by the sea, across the Jordan, Galilee of the gentiles—
speaker: Narrator

text:
the people who sat in darkness
    have seen a great light,
and for those who sat in the region and shadow of death
    light has dawned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time Jesus began to proclaim, “Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he walked by the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea—for they were fishers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Follow me, and I will make you fishers of people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately they left their nets and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he went from there, he saw two other brothers, James son of Zebedee and his brother John, in the boat with their father Zebedee, mending their nets, and he called them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went throughout all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and curing every disease and every sickness among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So his fame spread throughout all Syria, and they brought to him all the sick, those who were afflicted with various diseases and pains, people possessed by demons or having epilepsy or afflicted with paralysis, and he cured them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And great crowds followed him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and from beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw the crowds, he went up the mountain, and after he sat down, his disciples came to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began to speak and taught them, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the merciful, for they will receive mercy.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are those who are persecuted for the sake of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Blessed are you when people revile you and persecute you and utter all kinds of evil against you falsely on my account.
speaker: Jesus

text: Rejoice and be glad, for your reward is great in heaven, for in the same way they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the salt of the earth, but if salt has lost its taste, how can its saltiness be restored? It is no longer good for anything but is thrown out and trampled under foot.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You are the light of the world. A city built on a hill cannot be hid.
speaker: Jesus

text: People do not light a lamp and put it under the bushel basket; rather, they put it on the lampstand, and it gives light to all in the house.
speaker: Jesus

text: In the same way, let your light shine before others, so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I have come not to abolish but to fulfill.
speaker: Jesus

text: For truly I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not one letter, not one stroke of a letter, will pass from the law until all is accomplished.
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore, whoever breaks one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do the same will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever does them and teaches them will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: For I tell you, unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said to those of ancient times, ‘You shall not murder,’ and ‘whoever murders shall be liable to judgment.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that if you are angry with a brother or sister, you will be liable to judgment, and if you insult a brother or sister, you will be liable to the council, and if you say, ‘You fool,’ you will be liable to the hell of fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: So when you are offering your gift at the altar, if you remember that your brother or sister has something against you,
speaker: Jesus

text: leave your gift there before the altar and go; first be reconciled to your brother or sister, and then come and offer your gift.
speaker: Jesus

text: Come to terms quickly with your accuser while you are on the way to court with him, or your accuser may hand you over to the judge and the judge to the guard, and you will be thrown into prison.
speaker: Jesus

text: Truly I tell you, you will never get out until you have paid the last penny.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that everyone who looks at a woman with lust has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: If your right eye causes you to sin, tear it out and throw it away; it is better for you to lose one of your members than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: And if your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away; it is better for you to lose one of your members than for your whole body to go into hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: “It was also said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife, let him give her a certificate of divorce.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you that anyone who divorces his wife, except on the ground of sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery, and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Again, you have heard that it was said to those of ancient times, ‘You shall not swear falsely, but carry out the vows you have made to the Lord.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you: Do not swear at all, either by heaven, for it is the throne of God,
speaker: Jesus

text: or by the earth, for it is his footstool, or by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.
speaker: Jesus

text: And do not swear by your head, for you cannot make one hair white or black.
speaker: Jesus

text: Let your word be ‘Yes, Yes’ or ‘No, No’; anything more than this comes from the evil one.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you: Do not resist an evildoer. But if anyone strikes you on the right cheek, turn the other also,
speaker: Jesus

text: and if anyone wants to sue you and take your shirt, give your coat as well,
speaker: Jesus

text: and if anyone forces you to go one mile, go also the second mile.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give to the one who asks of you, and do not refuse anyone who wants to borrow from you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor and hate your enemy.’
speaker: Jesus

text: But I say to you: Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that you may be children of your Father in heaven, for he makes his sun rise on the evil and on the good and sends rain on the righteous and on the unrighteous.
speaker: Jesus

text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do the same?
speaker: Jesus

text: And if you greet only your brothers and sisters, what more are you doing than others? Do not even the gentiles do the same?
speaker: Jesus

text: Be perfect, therefore, as your heavenly Father is perfect.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Beware of practicing your righteousness before others in order to be seen by them, for then you have no reward from your Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “So whenever you give alms, do not sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may be praised by others. Truly I tell you, they have received their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you give alms, do not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that your alms may be done in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “And whenever you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and at the street corners, so that they may be seen by others. Truly I tell you, they have received their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But whenever you pray, go into your room and shut the door and pray to your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “When you are praying, do not heap up empty phrases as the gentiles do, for they think that they will be heard because of their many words.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.
speaker: Jesus

text:
“Pray, then, in this way:
Our Father in heaven,
    may your name be revered as holy.
speaker: Jesus

text:
May your kingdom come.
    May your will be done
        on earth as it is in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: Give us today our daily bread.
speaker: Jesus

text:
And forgive us our debts,
        as we also have forgiven our debtors.
speaker: Jesus

text:
And do not bring us to the time of trial,
        but rescue us from the evil one.
speaker: Jesus

text: “For if you forgive others their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you,
speaker: Jesus

text: but if you do not forgive others, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
speaker: Jesus

text: “And whenever you fast, do not look somber, like the hypocrites, for they mark their faces to show others that they are fasting. Truly I tell you, they have received their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: But when you fast, put oil on your head and wash your face,
speaker: Jesus

text: so that your fasting may be seen not by others but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father who sees in secret will reward you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust consume and where thieves break in and steal,
speaker: Jesus

text: but store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consumes and where thieves do not break in and steal.
speaker: Jesus

text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
speaker: Jesus

text: “The eye is the lamp of the body. So if your eye is healthy, your whole body will be full of light,
speaker: Jesus

text: but if your eye is unhealthy, your whole body will be full of darkness. If, then, the light in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one can serve two masters, for a slave will either hate the one and love the other or be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve God and wealth.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or what you will drink, or about your body, what you will wear. Is not life more than food and the body more than clothing?
speaker: Jesus

text: Look at the birds of the air: they neither sow nor reap nor gather into barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not of more value than they?
speaker: Jesus

text: And which of you by worrying can add a single hour to your span of life?
speaker: Jesus

text: And why do you worry about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they neither toil nor spin,
speaker: Jesus

text: yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not clothed like one of these.
speaker: Jesus

text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which is alive today and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, will he not much more clothe you—you of little faith?
speaker: Jesus

text: Therefore do not worry, saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?’
speaker: Jesus

text: For it is the gentiles who seek all these things, and indeed your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.
speaker: Jesus

text: But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
speaker: Jesus

text: “So do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will bring worries of its own. Today’s trouble is enough for today.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not judge, so that you may not be judged.
speaker: Jesus

text: For the judgment you give will be the judgment you get, and the measure you give will be the measure you get.
speaker: Jesus

text: Why do you see the speck in your neighbor’s eye but do not notice the log in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or how can you say to your neighbor, ‘Let me take the speck out of your eye,’ while the log is in your own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your neighbor’s eye.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not give what is holy to dogs, and do not throw your pearls before swine, or they will trample them under foot and turn and maul you.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Ask, and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
speaker: Jesus

text: For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who searches finds, and for everyone who knocks, the door will be opened.
speaker: Jesus

text: Is there anyone among you who, if your child asked for bread, would give a stone?
speaker: Jesus

text: Or if the child asked for a fish, would give a snake?
speaker: Jesus

text: If you, then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him!
speaker: Jesus

text: “In everything do to others as you would have them do to you, for this is the Law and the Prophets.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Enter through the narrow gate, for the gate is wide and the road is easy that leads to destruction, and there are many who take it.
speaker: Jesus

text: For the gate is narrow and the road is hard that leads to life, and there are few who find it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing but inwardly are ravenous wolves.
speaker: Jesus

text: You will know them by their fruits. Are grapes gathered from thorns or figs from thistles?
speaker: Jesus

text: In the same way, every good tree bears good fruit, but the bad tree bears bad fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit.
speaker: Jesus

text: Every tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: Thus you will know them by their fruits.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the one who does the will of my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: On that day many will say to me, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and cast out demons in your name, and do many mighty works in your name?’
speaker: Jesus

text: Then I will declare to them, ‘I never knew you; go away from me, you who behave lawlessly.’
speaker: Jesus

text: “Everyone, then, who hears these words of mine and acts on them will be like a wise man who built his house on rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain fell, the floods came, and the winds blew and beat on that house, but it did not fall because it had been founded on rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: And everyone who hears these words of mine and does not act on them will be like a foolish man who built his house on sand.
speaker: Jesus

text: The rain fell, and the floods came, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell—and great was its fall!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when Jesus had finished saying these words, the crowds were astounded at his teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he taught them as one having authority and not as their scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had come down from the mountain, great crowds followed him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and there was a man with a skin disease who came to him and knelt before him, saying, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, “I am willing. Be made clean!” Immediately his skin disease was cleansed.
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus said to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When he entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, appealing to him
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “Lord, my servant is lying at home paralyzed, in terrible distress.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, “I will come and cure him.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The centurion answered, “Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof, but only speak the word, and my servant will be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I also am a man under authority, with soldiers under me, and I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this,’ and the slave does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard him, he was amazed and said to those who followed him, “Truly I tell you, in no one in Israel have I found such faith.
speaker: Jesus

text: I tell you, many will come from east and west and will take their places at the banquet with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven,
speaker: Jesus

text: while the heirs of the kingdom will be thrown into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And Jesus said to the centurion, “Go; let it be done for you according to your faith.” And the servant was healed in that hour.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus entered Peter’s house, he saw his mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever;
speaker: Narrator

text: he touched her hand, and the fever left her, and she got up and began to serve him.
speaker: Narrator

text: That evening they brought to him many who were possessed by demons, and he cast out the spirits with a word and cured all who were sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was to fulfill what had been spoken through the prophet Isaiah, “He took our infirmities and bore our diseases.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus saw great crowds around him, he gave orders to go over to the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: A scribe then approached and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Another of his disciples said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to him, “Follow me, and let the dead bury their own dead.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And when he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A windstorm suddenly arose on the sea, so great that the boat was being swamped by the waves, but he was asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went and woke him up, saying, “Lord, save us! We are perishing!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Why are you afraid, you of little faith?” Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a dead calm.
speaker: Jesus

text: They were amazed, saying, “What sort of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two men possessed by demons came out of the tombs and met him. They were so fierce that no one could pass that way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly they shouted, “What have you to do with us, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a large herd of swine was feeding at some distance from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The demons begged him, “If you cast us out, send us into the herd of swine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Go!” So they came out and entered the swine, and suddenly, the whole herd stampeded down the steep bank into the sea and drowned in the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The swineherds ran off, and, going into the town, they told the whole story about what had happened to the men possessed by demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole town came out to meet Jesus, and when they saw him they begged him to leave their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after getting into a boat he crossed the sea and came to his own town.
speaker: Narrator

text: And some people were carrying to him a paralyzed man lying on a stretcher. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “Take heart, child; your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then some of the scribes said to themselves, “This man is blaspheming.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, said, “Why do you think evil in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: For which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he then said to the paralytic—“Stand up, take your bed, and go to your home.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he stood up and went to his home.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds saw it, they were filled with awe, and they glorified God, who had given such authority to human beings.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus was walking along, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax-collection station, and he said to him, “Follow me.” And he got up and followed him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And as he sat at dinner in the house, many tax collectors and sinners came and were sitting with Jesus and his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to his disciples, “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he heard this, he said, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick.
speaker: Jesus

text: Go and learn what this means, ‘I desire mercy, not sacrifice.’ For I have not come to call the righteous but sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the disciples of John came to him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “The wedding attendants cannot mourn as long as the bridegroom is with them, can they? The days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old cloak, for the patch pulls away from the cloak, and a worse tear is made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither is new wine put into old wineskins; otherwise, the skins burst, and the wine is spilled, and the skins are ruined, but new wine is put into fresh wineskins, and so both are preserved.”
speaker: Jesus

text: While he was saying these things to them, suddenly a leader came in and knelt before him, saying, “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus got up and followed him, with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then suddenly a woman who had been suffering from a flow of blood for twelve years came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak,
speaker: Narrator

text: for she was saying to herself, “If I only touch his cloak, I will be made well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus turned, and seeing her he said, “Take heart, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that moment.
speaker: Jesus

text: When Jesus came to the leader’s house and saw the flute players and the crowd making a commotion,
speaker: Narrator

text: he said, “Go away, for the girl is not dead but sleeping.” And they laughed at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the crowd had been put outside, he went in and took her by the hand, and the girl got up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the report of this spread through all of that district.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, crying loudly, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he entered the house, the blind men came to him, and Jesus said to them, “Do you have faith that I can do this?” They said to him, “Yes, Lord.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then he touched their eyes and said, “According to your faith, let it be done to you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And their eyes were opened. Then Jesus sternly ordered them, “See that no one knows of this.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But they went away and spread the news about him through all of that district.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had gone away, a demon-possessed man who was mute was brought to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the demon had been cast out, the one who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were amazed and said, “Never has anything like this been seen in Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees were saying, “By the ruler of the demons he casts out the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus went about all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and curing every disease and every sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion for them because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few;
speaker: Jesus

text: therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then Jesus summoned his twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to cure every disease and every sickness.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of the twelve apostles: first, Simon, also known as Peter, and his brother Andrew; James son of Zebedee and his brother John;
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James son of Alphaeus and Thaddaeus;
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon the Cananaean and Judas Iscariot, the one who betrayed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: These twelve Jesus sent out with the following instructions: “Do not take a road leading to gentiles, and do not enter a Samaritan town,
speaker: Jesus

text: but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you go, proclaim the good news, ‘The kingdom of heaven has come near.’
speaker: Jesus

text: Cure the sick; raise the dead; cleanse those with a skin disease; cast out demons. You received without payment; give without payment.
speaker: Jesus

text: Take no gold, or silver, or copper in your belts,
speaker: Jesus

text: no bag for your journey, or two tunics, or sandals, or a staff, for laborers deserve their food.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whatever town or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy, and stay there until you leave.
speaker: Jesus

text: As you enter the house, greet it.
speaker: Jesus

text: If the house is worthy, let your peace come upon it, but if it is not worthy, let your peace return to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: If anyone will not welcome you or listen to your words, shake off the dust from your feet as you leave that house or town.
speaker: Jesus

text: Truly I tell you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town.
speaker: Jesus

text: “I am sending you out like sheep into the midst of wolves, so be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.
speaker: Jesus

text: Beware of them, for they will hand you over to councils and flog you in their synagogues,
speaker: Jesus

text: and you will be dragged before governors and kings because of me, as a testimony to them and the gentiles.
speaker: Jesus

text: When they hand you over, do not worry about how you are to speak or what you are to say, for what you are to say will be given to you at that time,
speaker: Jesus

text: for it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father speaking through you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Sibling will betray sibling to death and a father his child, and children will rise against parents and have them put to death,
speaker: Jesus

text: and you will be hated by all because of my name. But the one who endures to the end will be saved.
speaker: Jesus

text: When they persecute you in this town, flee to the next, for truly I tell you, you will not have finished going through all the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
speaker: Jesus

text: “A disciple is not above the teacher nor a slave above the master;
speaker: Jesus

text: it is enough for the disciple to be like the teacher and the slave like the master. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more will they malign those of his household!
speaker: Jesus

text: “So have no fear of them, for nothing is covered up that will not be uncovered and nothing secret that will not become known.
speaker: Jesus

text: What I say to you in the dark, tell in the light, and what you hear whispered, proclaim from the housetops.
speaker: Jesus

text: Do not fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul; rather, fear the one who can destroy both soul and body in hell.
speaker: Jesus

text: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground apart from your Father.
speaker: Jesus

text: And even the hairs of your head are all counted.
speaker: Jesus

text: So do not be afraid; you are of more value than many sparrows.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Everyone, therefore, who acknowledges me before others, I also will acknowledge before my Father in heaven,
speaker: Jesus

text: but whoever denies me before others, I also will deny before my Father in heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace to the earth; I have not come to bring peace but a sword.
speaker: Jesus

text:
For I have come to set a man against his father,
and a daughter against her mother,
and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law,
speaker: Jesus

text: and one’s foes will be members of one’s own household.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me, and whoever loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me,
speaker: Jesus

text: and whoever does not take up the cross and follow me is not worthy of me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who find their life will lose it, and those who lose their life for my sake will find it.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Whoever welcomes you welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever welcomes a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward, and whoever welcomes a righteous person in the name of a righteous person will receive the reward of the righteous,
speaker: Jesus

text: and whoever gives even a cup of cold water to one of these little ones in the name of a disciple—truly I tell you, none of these will lose their reward.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and proclaim his message in their cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: When John heard in prison what the Messiah was doing, he sent word by his disciples
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Are you the one who is to come, or are we to wait for another?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John what you hear and see:
speaker: Narrator

text: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, those with a skin disease are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor have good news brought to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed is anyone who takes no offense at me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they went away, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to look at? A reed shaken by the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: What, then, did you go out to see? Someone dressed in soft robes? Look, those who wear soft robes are in royal palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text: What, then, did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the one about whom it is written,
‘See, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    who will prepare your way before you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Truly I tell you, among those born of women no one has arisen greater than John the Baptist, yet the least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven has suffered violence, and violent people take it by force.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John came,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if you are willing to accept it, he is Elijah who is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let anyone with ears listen!
speaker: Narrator

text: “But to what will I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces and calling to one another,
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘We played the flute for you, and you did not dance;
    we wailed, and you did not mourn.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon’;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Look, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ Yet wisdom is vindicated by her deeds.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he began to reproach the cities in which most of his deeds of power had been done because they did not repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the deeds of power done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you, on the day of judgment it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you, Capernaum,
will you be exalted to heaven?
    No, you will be brought down to Hades.
“For if the deeds of power done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have remained until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I tell you that on the day of judgment it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom than for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus said, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and the intelligent and have revealed them to infants;
speaker: Narrator

text: yes, Father, for such was your gracious will.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son and anyone to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come to me, all you who are weary and are carrying heavy burdens, and I will give you rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Jesus went through the grain fields on the Sabbath; his disciples were hungry, and they began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to him, “Look, your disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Have you not read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
speaker: Narrator

text: How he entered the house of God, and they ate the bread of the Presence, which it was not lawful for him or his companions to eat, but only for the priests?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or have you not read in the law that on the Sabbath the priests in the temple break the Sabbath and yet are guiltless?
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, something greater than the temple is here.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He left that place and entered their synagogue;
speaker: Narrator

text: a man was there with a withered hand, and they asked him, “Is it lawful to cure on the Sabbath?” so that they might accuse him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Suppose one of you has only one sheep and it falls into a pit on the Sabbath; will you not lay hold of it and lift it out?
speaker: Narrator

text: How much more valuable is a human being than a sheep! So it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” He stretched it out, and it was restored, as sound as the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees went out and conspired against him, how to destroy him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus became aware of this, he departed. Many followed him, and he cured all of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he ordered them not to make him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was to fulfill what had been spoken through the prophet Isaiah:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Here is my servant, whom I have chosen,
    my beloved, with whom my soul is well pleased.
I will put my Spirit upon him,
    and he will proclaim justice to the gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not wrangle or cry aloud,
    nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not break a bruised reed
    or quench a smoldering wick
until he brings justice to victory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in his name the gentiles will hope.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought to him a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute, and he cured him, so that the one who had been mute could speak and see.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the crowds were amazed and were saying, “Can this be the Son of David?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, “It is only by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons, that this man casts out the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He knew what they were thinking and said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste, and no city or house divided against itself will stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself; how, then, will his kingdom stand?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your own exorcists cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it is by the Spirit of God that I cast out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or how can one enter a strong man’s house and plunder his property without first tying up the strong man? Then indeed the house can be plundered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I tell you, people will be forgiven for every sin and blasphemy, but blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Either make the tree good and its fruit good, or make the tree bad and its fruit bad, for the tree is known by its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: You brood of vipers! How can you speak good things when you are evil? For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good person brings good things out of a good treasure, and the evil person brings evil things out of an evil treasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, on the day of judgment you will have to give an account for every careless word you utter,
speaker: Narrator

text: for by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees said to him, “Teacher, we wish to see a sign from you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “An evil and adulterous generation asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the sea monster, so for three days and three nights the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Nineveh will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the proclamation of Jonah, and indeed something greater than Jonah is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: The queen of the South will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because she came from the ends of the earth to listen to the wisdom of Solomon, and indeed something greater than Solomon is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it wanders through waterless regions looking for a resting place, but it finds none.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’ When it returns, it finds it empty, swept, and put in order.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes and brings along seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and live there, and the last state of that person is worse than the first. So will it be also with this evil generation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking to the crowds, his mother and his brothers were standing outside, wanting to speak to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Someone told him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to speak to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the one who had told him this, Jesus replied, “Who is my mother, and who are my brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And pointing to his disciples, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat beside the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such great crowds gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat there, while the whole crowd stood on the beach.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he told them many things in parables, saying: “Listen! A sower went out to sow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he sowed, some seeds fell on a path, and the birds came and ate them up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell on rocky ground, where they did not have much soil, and they sprang up quickly, since they had no depth of soil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the sun rose, they were scorched, and since they had no root, they withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell on good soil and brought forth grain, some a hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you have ears, hear!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came and asked him, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it has not been given.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to those who have, more will be given, and they will have an abundance, but from those who have nothing, even what they have will be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: The reason I speak to them in parables is that ‘seeing they do not perceive, and hearing they do not listen, nor do they understand.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
With them indeed is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah that says:
‘You will indeed listen but never understand,
    and you will indeed look but never perceive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this people’s heart has grown dull,
    and their ears are hard of hearing,
        and they have shut their eyes,
        so that they might not look with their eyes,
    and hear with their ears
and understand with their heart and turn—
    and I would heal them.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “But blessed are your eyes, for they see, and your ears, for they hear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I tell you, many prophets and righteous people longed to see what you see but did not see it and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Hear, then, the parable of the sower.
speaker: Narrator

text: When anyone hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what is sown in the heart; this is what was sown on the path.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for what was sown on rocky ground, this is the one who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet such a person has no root but endures only for a while, and when trouble or persecution arises on account of the word, that person immediately falls away.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for what was sown among thorns, this is the one who hears the word, but the cares of this age and the lure of wealth choke the word, and it yields nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for what was sown on good soil, this is the one who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and yields in one case a hundredfold, in another sixty, and in another thirty.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He put before them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to someone who sowed good seed in his field,
speaker: Narrator

text: but while everybody was asleep an enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and then went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the plants came up and bore grain, then the weeds appeared as well.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the slaves of the householder came and said to him, ‘Master, did you not sow good seed in your field? Where, then, did these weeds come from?’
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The slaves said to him, ‘Then do you want us to go and gather them?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But he replied, ‘No, for in gathering the weeds you would uproot the wheat along with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let both of them grow together until the harvest, and at harvest time I will tell the reapers, Collect the weeds first and bind them in bundles to be burned, but gather the wheat into my barn.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: He put before them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that someone took and sowed in his field;
speaker: Narrator

text: it is the smallest of all the seeds, but when it has grown it is the greatest of shrubs and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and make nests in its branches.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He told them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and mixed in with three measures of flour until all of it was leavened.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus told the crowds all these things in parables; without a parable he told them nothing.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Then he left the crowds and went into the house. And his disciples approached him, saying, “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man;
speaker: Narrator

text: the field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the kingdom; the weeds are the children of the evil one,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the enemy who sowed them is the devil; the harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the weeds are collected and burned up with fire, so will it be at the end of the age.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Son of Man will send his angels, and they will collect out of his kingdom all causes of sin and all evildoers,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will throw them into the furnace of fire, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of their Father. Let anyone with ears listen!
speaker: Narrator

text: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and reburied; then in his joy he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant in search of fine pearls;
speaker: Narrator

text: on finding one pearl of great value, he went and sold all that he had and bought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was thrown into the sea and caught fish of every kind;
speaker: Narrator

text: when it was full, they drew it ashore, sat down, and put the good into baskets but threw out the bad.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come out and separate the evil from the righteous
speaker: Narrator

text: and throw them into the furnace of fire, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Have you understood all this?” They answered, “Yes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Therefore every scribe who has become a disciple in the kingdom of heaven is like the master of a household who brings out of his treasure what is new and what is old.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had finished these parables, he left that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to his hometown and began to teach the people in their synagogue, so that they were astounded and said, “Where did this man get this wisdom and these deeds of power?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this the carpenter’s son? Is not his mother called Mary? And are not his brothers James and Joseph and Simon and Judas?
speaker: Narrator

text: And are not all his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took offense at him. But Jesus said to them, “Prophets are not without honor except in their own hometown and in their own house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did not do many deeds of power there, because of their unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Herod the ruler heard reports about Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he has been raised from the dead, and for this reason these powers are at work in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod had arrested John, bound him, and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: because John had been telling him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Though Herod wanted to put him to death, he feared the crowd, because they regarded him as a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced before the company, and she pleased Herod
speaker: Narrator

text: so much that he promised on oath to grant her whatever she might ask.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me the head of John the Baptist here on a platter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The king was grieved, yet out of regard for his oaths and for the guests, he commanded it to be given;
speaker: Narrator

text: he sent and had John beheaded in the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: His head was brought on a platter and given to the girl, who brought it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples came and took the body and buried him; then they went and told Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat to a deserted place by himself. But when the crowds heard it, they followed him on foot from the towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he went ashore, he saw a great crowd, and he had compassion for them and cured their sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, the disciples came to him and said, “This is a deserted place, and the hour is now late; send the crowds away so that they may go into the villages and buy food for themselves.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “They need not go away; you give them something to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They replied, “We have nothing here but five loaves and two fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Bring them here to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he ordered the crowds to sit down on the grass. Taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed and broke the loaves and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all ate and were filled, and they took up what was left over of the broken pieces, twelve baskets full.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he made the disciples get into a boat and go on ahead to the other side, while he dismissed the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after he had dismissed the crowds, he went up the mountain by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone,
speaker: Narrator

text: but by this time the boat, battered by the waves, was far from the land, for the wind was against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And early in the morning he came walking toward them on the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were terrified, saying, “It is a ghost!” And they cried out in fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But immediately Jesus spoke to them and said, “Take heart, it is I; do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter answered him, “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Come.” So Peter got out of the boat, started walking on the water, and came toward Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when he noticed the strong wind, he became frightened, and, beginning to sink, he cried out, “Lord, save me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus immediately reached out his hand and caught him, saying to him, “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they got into the boat, the wind ceased.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those in the boat worshiped him, saying, “Truly you are the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the people of that place recognized him, they sent word to that whole surrounding region, and people brought all who were sick to him
speaker: Narrator

text: and begged him that they might touch even the fringe of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem and said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands before they eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “And why do you break the commandment of God for the sake of your tradition?
speaker: Narrator

text: For God said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever speaks evil of father or mother must surely die.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But you say that whoever tells father or mother, ‘Whatever support you might have had from me is given to God,’ then that person need not honor the father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, for the sake of your tradition, you nullify the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You hypocrites! Isaiah prophesied rightly about you when he said:
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘This people honors me with their lips,
    but their hearts are far from me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
in vain do they worship me,
    teaching human precepts as doctrines.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called the crowd to him and said to them, “Listen and understand:
speaker: Narrator

text: it is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but it is what comes out of the mouth that defiles.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples approached and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees took offense when they heard what you said?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “Every plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them alone; they are blind guides of the blind. And if one blind person guides another, both will fall into a pit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said to him, “Explain this parable to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, “Are you also still without understanding?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not see that whatever goes into the mouth enters the stomach and goes out into the sewer?
speaker: Narrator

text: But what comes out of the mouth proceeds from the heart, and this is what defiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of the heart come evil intentions, murder, adultery, sexual immorality, theft, false witness, slander.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are what defile a person, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus left that place and went away to the district of Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then a Canaanite woman from that region came out and started shouting, “Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David; my daughter is tormented by a demon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he did not answer her at all. And his disciples came and urged him, saying, “Send her away, for she keeps shouting after us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But she came and knelt before him, saying, “Lord, help me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “It is not fair to take the children’s food and throw it to the dogs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “Yes, Lord, yet even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, great is your faith! Let it be done for you as you wish.” And her daughter was healed from that moment.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus had left that place, he passed along the Sea of Galilee, and he went up the mountain, where he sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Great crowds came to him, bringing with them the lame, the blind, the maimed, the mute, and many others. They put them at his feet, and he cured them,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the crowd was amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. And they praised the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus called his disciples to him and said, “I have compassion for the crowd because they have been with me now for three days and have nothing to eat, and I do not want to send them away hungry, for they might faint on the way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples said to him, “Where are we to get enough bread in the desert to feed so great a crowd?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus asked them, “How many loaves have you?” They said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ordering the crowd to sit down on the ground,
speaker: Narrator

text: he took the seven loaves and the fish, and after giving thanks he broke them and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all of them ate and were filled, and they took up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had eaten were four thousand men, besides women and children.
speaker: Narrator

text: After sending away the crowds, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees and Sadducees came, and to test Jesus they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the morning, ‘It will be stormy today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times.
speaker: Narrator

text: An evil and adulterous generation asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.” Then he left them and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples reached the other side, they had forgotten to bring any bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Watch out, and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to one another, “It is because we have brought no bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And becoming aware of it, Jesus said, “You of little faith, why are you talking about having no bread?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you still not perceive? Do you not remember the five loaves for the five thousand and how many baskets you gathered?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or the seven loaves for the four thousand and how many baskets you gathered?
speaker: Narrator

text: How could you fail to perceive that I was not speaking about bread? Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they understood that he had not told them to beware of the yeast of bread but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus came into the district of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said, “Some say John the Baptist but others Elijah and still others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered him, “Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah! For flesh and blood has not revealed this to you but my Father in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I tell you, you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he sternly ordered the disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time on, Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and undergo great suffering at the hands of the elders and chief priests and scribes and be killed and on the third day be raised.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, saying, “God forbid it, Lord! This must never happen to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he turned and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a hindrance to me, for you are setting your mind not on divine things but on human things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus told his disciples, “If any wish to come after me, let them deny themselves and take up their cross and follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who want to save their life will lose it, and those who lose their life for my sake will find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what will it profit them if they gain the whole world but forfeit their life? Or what will they give in return for their life?
speaker: Narrator

text: “For the Son of Man is to come with his angels in the glory of his Father, and then he will repay everyone for what has been done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I tell you, there are some standing here who will not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days later, Jesus took with him Peter and James and his brother John and led them up a high mountain, by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became bright as light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly there appeared to them Moses and Elijah, talking with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to Jesus, “Lord, it is good for us to be here; if you wish, I will set up three tents here, one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, suddenly a bright cloud overshadowed them, and a voice from the cloud said, “This is my Son, the Beloved; with him I am well pleased; listen to him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the disciples heard this, they fell to the ground and were overcome by fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus came and touched them, saying, “Get up and do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they raised their eyes, they saw no one except Jesus himself alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus ordered them, “Tell no one about the vision until after the Son of Man has been raised from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the disciples asked him, “Why, then, do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He replied, “Elijah is indeed coming and will restore all things,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I tell you that Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but they did to him whatever they pleased. So also the Son of Man is about to suffer at their hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples understood that he was speaking to them about John the Baptist.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to the crowd, a man came to him, knelt before him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Lord, have mercy on my son, for he has epilepsy and suffers terribly; he often falls into the fire and often into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I brought him to your disciples, but they could not cure him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “You faithless and perverse generation, how much longer must I be with you? How much longer must I put up with you? Bring him here to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus rebuked the demon, and it came out of him, and the boy was cured from that moment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, “Why could we not cast it out?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Because of your little faith. For truly I tell you, if you have faith the size of a mustard seed, you will say to this mountain, ‘Move from here to there,’ and it will move, and nothing will be impossible for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were gathering in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into human hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised.” And they were greatly distressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they reached Capernaum, the collectors of the temple tax came to Peter and said, “Does your teacher not pay the temple tax?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Yes, he does.” And when he came home, Jesus spoke of it first, asking, “What do you think, Simon? From whom do kings of the earth take toll or tribute? From their children or from others?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter said, “From others,” Jesus said to him, “Then the children are free.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, so that we do not give offense to them, go to the sea and cast a hook; take the first fish that comes up, and when you open its mouth you will find a coin; take that and give it to them for you and me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He called a child, whom he put among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Truly I tell you, unless you change and become like children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever becomes humble like this child is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever welcomes one such child in my name welcomes me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If any of you cause one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for you if a great millstone were fastened around your neck and you were drowned in the depth of the sea.
speaker: Narrator
